description: You will learn how to transform houses and apartments, create drawings and 3D visualization. You can take high-paying orders or open a design studio

questions.question: What is UX/UI Design?
questions.answer: UX/UI Design involves creating user-friendly interfaces and experiences for digital products. UX focuses on the overall experience, while UI deals with the visual and interactive elements.

questions.question: How can I improve my design skills?
questions.answer: Improving your design skills involves continuous learning and practice. Engage with design communities, take online courses, and work on personal projects to hone your abilities.

questions.question: What tools are essential for a designer?
questions.answer: Essential tools for designers include software like Adobe XD, Sketch, Figma for UI/UX design, and Adobe Photoshop or Illustrator for graphic design. Additionally, prototyping and collaboration tools are beneficial.

questions.question: How do I start a career in UX/UI Design?
questions.answer: Start by building a strong portfolio showcasing your projects. Gain experience through internships or freelance work, and consider obtaining relevant certifications. Networking and staying updated with industry trends are also crucial.

modules.title: Module 1: UX Design (2 mos)
modules.moduleDesc: will learn the fundamentals of user-centered design, including user research, information architecture, and interaction design. They will develop strong problem-solving skills and create user-centric solutions.

modules.title: Introduction to Frontend Development(3 mos)
modules.moduleDesc: Learn the basics of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Understand how to structure web pages, style them, and add interactivity.

modules.title: Advanced JavaScript and Frameworks(3 mos)
modules.moduleDesc: Dive deeper into JavaScript and explore popular frontend frameworks like React, Vue, or Angular. Build dynamic and scalable web applications.

modules.title: Intership (3mos)
modules.moduleDesc: Work on real-world frontend projects. Learn how to deploy applications, optimize performance, and ensure cross-browser compatibility.

questions.question: What is Frontend Development?
questions.answer: Frontend Development involves building the part of a website or application that users interact with directly. It includes designing and coding the user interface using technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

questions.question: Which programming languages should I learn for Frontend Development?
questions.answer: Key programming languages for frontend development are HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Additionally, learning frameworks and libraries such as React, Angular, or Vue.js can be highly beneficial.

questions.question: What is the difference between a library and a framework in Frontend Development?
questions.answer: A library is a collection of pre-written code that developers can call upon to perform common tasks, while a framework provides a structured environment and dictates the architecture of your application.

questions.question: How can I make my website responsive?
questions.answer: To make your website responsive, use flexible grid layouts, media queries, and responsive images. Ensure that your design adapts to different screen sizes and devices by testing across various platforms.

instructors.name: Murad Abdullazadə
instructors.workPosition: Middle Frontend at Mega Concept LLC

modules.title: Introduction to Backend Development (3mos)
modules.moduleDesc: Learn the fundamentals of server-side development. Understand how to work with databases, APIs, and server architecture using languages like Python or Java.

modules.title: Databases and Data Management (3mos)
modules.moduleDesc: Explore relational and non-relational databases such as MySQL and MongoDB. Learn how to design, query, and manage data effectively.

modules.title: Building and Deploying APIs (3mos)
modules.moduleDesc: Create RESTful APIs and understand how to manage authentication, security, and scalability. Deploy your applications to the cloud using services like AWS or Heroku.

questions.question: What is Backend Development?
questions.answer: Backend Development involves building the server-side of applications, managing databases, and ensuring that the frontend can effectively communicate with the server. It includes working with languages like Node.js, Python, Ruby, or Java.

questions.question: Which databases are commonly used in Backend Development?
questions.answer: Common databases used in backend development include MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, and Redis. The choice depends on the specific requirements of the application.

questions.question: What is an API and why is it important in Backend Development?
questions.answer: An API (Application Programming Interface) allows different software applications to communicate with each other. It is crucial in backend development for enabling frontend applications to interact with server-side logic and databases.

questions.question: How do you ensure the security of a backend application?
questions.answer: To ensure backend security, implement authentication and authorization, use encryption for sensitive data, validate and sanitize inputs to prevent injections, and regularly update and patch systems to protect against vulnerabilities.
